name: Doubletree Hotel Tulsa-Downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the DoubleTree downtown because we were going to an event at the nearby BOK Center. The hotel was easy to find and self-parking was $7. The lobby was beautiful and the employees were polite, but not overly friendly. Our room was as expected, but the hotel seemed older. We were able to hear our neighbors through the walls, so we did not get as much sleep as we would have liked. We complained about the noise to the front desk, but our neighbors did not get any quieter. The location of the hotel was great though; we walked to the BOK Center and it took less than 10 minutes. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Older hotel, but great location!

reviews.text: I was in town for a wedding and stayed for 4 days. Hotel is located close to downtown, with good access to freeway. It was impeccably clean (I believe they recently renovated), and everything in the room was new except for bathroom. I had a standard room (which was fine, since I spent most of my time visiting family), including a king size bed with lots of down pillows and comforter, free newspaper every morning, coffee machine, iron, etc. Staff was very helpful. They have a large parking structure in back for $7/day with unlimited in/out privileges. Cafe on site serves absolutely the most delicious breakfast potatoes - yummmmm!
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, centrally located

reviews.text: I am a Frontier flight attendant and you could say that I've stayed at my fair share of hotels, and unfortunatley it's often been my experience that hotels treat flight crews with inferior care than their regular guests. This, however, is NOT the case at the Doubletree downtown. I really needed to get my nails done and with my erratic schedule, I was forced to find a salon in a strange city, so I called the front desk and spoke to Ashley who not only found one but made an appointment for me! Then Joyce (bless her heart) drove, and picked me up from, the salon. It was a small gesture but it made me feel so welcome... a feeling I don't get to have very often. I can't wait to work a flight here again! Thanks girls!!
reviews.title: Best concierge and front desk! Joyce and Ashley!

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel on an interview. The hotel room is decent and clean. However the people on the front desk is not very patient in answering questions. Also later I found out later there is wrong charge on my credit card and I tried to call the hotel. First the front desk transferred my call to a certain person who is supposed to handle this kind of dispute. But that person never answered her phone and I left a message with my cell phone # and the reason of my call. She never bothered to call me back. So far the wrong charge is still on my credit card. So watch your bill when you decide to stay there.
reviews.title: service is bad

reviews.text: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was excellent and most importantly the staff was very professional and extremely friendly. They were very responsive to their customers needs.
reviews.title: Outstanding Service!

reviews.text: My office had accidently shipped a box to the wrong DoubleTree but Joyce Clark (Concierge) went out of her way to make my problem hers. She went over and above to help me fix the situation even on her own time. What a sweethart. I've always appreciated staying at Hilton properties but with staff like this who would stay anywhere else.
reviews.title: Sweetest Concierge - Joyce Clark

reviews.text: Julie - Wisconsin
reviews.title: Great Customer Service

reviews.text: My name is Michael McConnell and i am in a wheelchair and the hotel was not equipped with a wheelchair lift van so they came to pick me up at the airport with there pilot vechile and had another vechile and guys there to throw my wheelchair in the back and brought me to the hotel. Once I got to the hotel the service was wonderful. They did the same thing on the way back to the airport..They care about their clients.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’m on the road generally 3 weeks out of each month, and I travel all over the country. This facility was “Terrific”. The staff was polite, courteous, and they were extremely helpful with suggestions for dinner. Being on the road, I enjoy working out early in the morning and also when I return to the hotel after work. This was the Best physical fitness center that I’ve seen this year. Thanks for making my stay enjoyable.
reviews.title: Nickeled and Dimed us from the moment we arrive to the time we left

reviews.text: BTW: The towels in the room were the fluffiest that I’ve ever seen on the road…
reviews.title: Royal service

reviews.text: We stayed for a convention, thinking a convention hotel connected to the site- good plan! Not so much. There were 2 of us in the room, and in the 3 day stay, not once did both of our room keys work, though they corrected the problem many times- (supposedly) at the front desk. The restaurant attached was not prepared to handle convention numbers- again- connected to the site- how can they not bring in the staff?? The room was clean, but very thin walls at times made it difficult to carry on a conversation. There was someone in a hallway painting the walls DURING the day when people were walking by to attend the convention. The ice on the sidewalks was not cleared and very dangerous- same for the parking garage. This hotel was a disappointment and not worth the price.
reviews.title: Glad to be leaving!

reviews.text: We came to Tulsa for a concert and ended up being iced in for a second day. Every one on staff was so nice and tried very hard to make our stay enjoyable.I can't say enough about the friendliness of all the employees from the front desk to the resturant to housekeeping.We will defintely stay there anytime we go to Tulsa. The room was nice and the beds were great!
reviews.title: concert and ice storm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the double tree the night of our wedding for thier romance package and what a joke it was. First of all, they lost our payment information as my father-in-law payed several days in advance with his credit card. They even faxed him back a conformation?! Anyhow, once we finally checked in we were not impressed with our room. We could hear people having party a few doors down as we tried to sleep, paper thin walls I suppose. After calling security several times throughout the night we finally got some zzzs. There won't be a next time for us at the double tree of tulsa, will try the Crown Plaza next time.
reviews.title: would not stay at this double tree again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the hotel on Nov 1 for just one night. This was probably our third of fourth stay at this location.
reviews.title: Good hotel - needs update

reviews.text: The hotel is convenient to the convention center (has skywalk directly to the building), the new BOK center and really anyplace downtown. We were there for a halloween party at the Brady theater which is a few blocks away.
reviews.title: Horrible Internet Speeds

reviews.text: This hotel is going through an extensive renovation but they know what they're doing. You wouldn't even know it was going on. And the staff is amazing.
reviews.title: knocked me off my feet

reviews.text: These people know hospitality, if I didn't know better I would think I had paid several hundred dollars for this STAR treatment and all for under a hundred bucks, INCREADABLE. Must stay when in Oklahoma!
reviews.title: Friendly Staff, But Otherwise Very Standard Doubletree

reviews.text: The Tulsa Downtown Doubletree is a decent business hotel, and has the usual amenities, but there is just not much special about the facility itself. It is clean enough, modern enough and convenient enough to downtown Tulsa to suit the needs of the visiting business person or other traveler, but it's hard for me to get excited about returning. The biggest positive item was the friendliness of the staff. That alone is why I rated the hotel "very good," instead of simply "average."
reviews.title: Blow my mind away amazing: staff, amenities, service, everything!

reviews.text: The location is convenient to the downtown area and the BOK Center, and is right across the street from the Tulsa Convention Center. Pretty much any location in downtown is walkable from the hotel, although you might feel a little bit insecure about walking in the area at night. It doesn't feel like the best part of town to be in, but I did it alone one evening and didn't feel threatened at all.
reviews.title: Doubletree Downtown Tulsa, OK

reviews.text: All-in-all, the friendly staff brings the rating up a bit, but otherwise, I would have simply rated it as average. I will stay here again, if returning to Tulsa, but the hotel itself was not particularly memorable.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff. Enjoyed my stay

description: The Doubletree Hotel Tulsa Downtown in the heart of downtown Tulsa is the official Host Hotel of the BOK Center and the only hotel connected directly to the Tulsa Convention Center. Our full service hotel is located in Tulsa's vibrant downtown business and entertainment district, making us the perfect choice for business or leisure travel. The Doubletree also provides complimentary shuttle service to and from Tulsa International Airport, only 15 minutes away.
